entry.summary: CD's Found in the Reliquary Gardens These CD's were donated by an anonymous party and left in the Reliquary Gardens on Havemeyer. We are unsure who the DJ is who compiled these tracks is, but are ready to credit him...
entry.dc:subject: shows
entry.content:
CD's Found in the Reliquary Gardens These CD's were donated by an anonymous party and left in the Reliquary Gardens on Havemeyer. We are unsure who the DJ is who compiled these tracks is, but are ready to credit him or her if anyone can identify them.

entry.title: Truckers Atlas
entry.summary: A Compilation Taken from The Road Tapes of Two Art Handlers Dave Herman, President and Jesse James Arnold, Web and Music Tech, spent six months traveling across this fine country of ours delivering famous, heavier than you would believe artworks,...
entry.dc:subject: shows
entry.content:
A Compilation Taken from The Road Tapes of Two Art Handlers Dave Herman, President and Jesse James Arnold, Web and Music Tech, spent six months traveling across this fine country of ours delivering famous, heavier than you would believe artworks, to both famous places you've never heard of, and to the souless rich.

In the midst of their travels one of the only things that kept them sane and kept them truckin were some of these songs. Through ice and snow, heavy rain and roadkill ( as well as the the vacant nothing that is South Dakota ), this was their soundtrack.

Click Here : See Whats On WCRM Radio Right Now

entry.title: Cover Story
entry.summary: An Ongoing WCRM Covers Show 11.12.05. Stranger and/or Stronger Its just no fun when a musician covers a song and it sounds too much like the original. The magic only seems to happen when a new artist appies his/her own...
entry.dc:subject: shows
entry.content:
An Ongoing WCRM Covers Show

11.12.05. Stranger and/or Stronger

Its just no fun when a musician covers a song and it sounds too much like the original. The magic only seems to happen when a new artist appies his/her own charms to a tune and changes it significantly - for better or worse.

Now Accepting Submissions for Mixes and Themes

Click Here : See Whats On WCRM Radio Right Now

entry.title: 40 Shuffled Songs
entry.summary: Try at Home and Amaze Your Friends! Step One : Select Party Shuffle in Your MP3 Music Player. Step Two : Shuffle Settings / 50 Songs Per Shuffle Step Three : Select At Leact One Song from Each Random Collection...
entry.dc:subject: shows
entry.content:
Try at Home and Amaze Your Friends!

Step One : Select Party Shuffle in Your MP3 Music Player.

Step Two : Shuffle Settings / 50 Songs Per Shuffle

Step Three : Select At Leact One Song from Each Random Collection from Your Library that Works For You

Step Four : Repeat Until You Have 40 Songs

Step Five : Enjoy This Game of Chance and Observe the Wild Juxtaposition of Genres That Unfolds
( Or You Can Just Go With Those New Tracks That You Know Rock )

Includes songs from:

Clap Your Hands
Animal Collective
Broken Social Scene
Silver Jews
Antony and the Johnsons
Spoon
Iron & Wine/ Calexico
Beta Band
Iggy Pop
X
Wilco
Earl Scruggs
Beck
My Morning Jacket
Ralph Stanley
Ray Charles
DJ Shadow
Sufjan Stevens
Kid Koala
Desert Sessions
Pixies
Devo
Ramones
Postal Service
Nintendo
Magnolia Electric Co.
David Bowie
Modest Mouse
Walkmen
Talking Heads
Strokes
Thin Lizzy
Unicorns
Lola Ray

entry.title: One Night Only
entry.summary: A Rotating Playlist A collection of songs from the bands that are the soundtrack to our events. All of the following bands donated their time and sounds to the City Reliquary and WCRM. We'd like to thank them by dedicating...
entry.dc:subject: shows
entry.content:
A Rotating Playlist

A collection of songs from the bands that are the soundtrack to our events. All of the following bands donated their time and sounds to the City Reliquary and WCRM. We'd like to thank them by dedicating a few hours of our airwaves each week to them.

Musicians & Bands Include :

The Good Good
Brasilia
Pinataland : More On the Band
Morex Optimo : More On the Band
The Circus Contraption Band : More On the Band
Victor Omas
Troubadour

Click Here : See Whats On WCRM Radio Right Now

entry.title: An Incomplete Collection : The History of Hip Hop
entry.summary: A Ongoing Show by Bill Scanga A collection that strives for completion but remains relatively content with the search and the exploration of the topic at hand. Volume One 1, Mean Machine Chant / The Last Poets 1971 2.Scorpio/ Grandmaster...
entry.dc:subject: shows
entry.content:
A Ongoing Show by Bill Scanga

A collection that strives for completion but remains relatively content with the search and the exploration of the topic at hand.

Volume One
1, Mean Machine Chant / The Last Poets 1971
2.Scorpio/ Grandmaster Flash and the Furious Five 1982
3.Planet rock/ Afrika Bambaatta and the Soul Sonic Force 1982
4.Trans Europe express/ Kraftwerk 1977
5.Rock it / Herby Hancock w/ Grandmixer D. ST 1983
6.Numbers / Kraftwerk 1981
7.Apache / Sugar Hill Gang 1981
8.Apache / Bongo Rock 1972
9.White horse/ Laid Back 1983
10.White lines / Grand master & Melle Mel 1983
11.Cavern/ Liquid Liquid 1981
12.Freak-a-zoid/ Midnight Star 1983
13.Genius of love/ Tom Tom Club 1981
14. More Bounce to the Once –Part I / Zapp 1980
15. Put the Boogie in Your Body / Treacherous Three 1981
16. Cuts It Up / Grandmixer D. ST
17. Friends / Whodini 1983
18. Funk Box Party / the Masterdon Committee
19. Potential 1980 / Mr. Magic
20. Hard times / Kurtis Blow

Volume Two
1. Smurf Across the Surf / the Micronawts 1983
2. Jam on it / Newcleus 1984
3. The Breaks / Kurtis Blow 1980
4. What is This? / Spoonie Gee 1982
5. Disco Dream / the Dream Machine
6. Change the Beat / Fab 5 Freddy
7. On the Radio / Crush Crew
8. Moody (spaced out) / ESG 1981
9. Double Trouble at the Amphitheatre/ Rodney Cee, K.K. Rockwell, DJ Stevie Steve 1983
10. title and date unknown please e-mail bill@cityreliquary.org with information
11. title and date unknown please e-mail bill@cityreliquary.org with information
12. Rapper’s Delight / The Sugarhill Gang 1979
13. Boogie Down Bronx / Man Parrish
14. Body Snatchers / Midnight Star 1984
15. Looking for the Perfect Beat / Afrika Bambaataa and the Soul Sonic Force 1982
16. Hustler’s Convention / Grand Master Melle Mel and the Furious Five 1884

Volume Three
1.Rapture/ Blondie 1980
2. Get up / Pookey Blow 1980
3. Magic’s Wand / Whodini 1982
4. Down by Law / Fab 5 Freddy 1983
5. The Adventures of Grandmaster Flash on the Wheels of Steel / Grandmaster Flash 1981
6. Beat Bop / Rahmelzee Vs. K Rob 1981
7. Reckless / Ice T 1984
8. The Coldest Rap / Ice T and the Time 19??
9. Pass the Beat / New Edition 1983
10, Love Rap / Spoonie Gee and the Treacherous Three 1979
11. Mean Machine / The Last Poets 1971
12. The Revolution Will Not Be Televised/ Gil Scott Heron 1971
13. When the Revolution Comes / the Last Poets 1970
14. Superappin/ grandmaster flash and the furious five 1981
15. The message/ grand master flash and the furious five 1982
16. Hip Hop, Be Bop (Don’t Stop) / Man Parrish 1982
17. Fly Guy Rap / Fly Guy
18. The New Rap Language / The Treacherous Three 1981
19. Pack Jam (look out for OVC) / Jonzun Crew 1982
20. Death Comet Crew with Rammellzee / Exterior Street 1994

entry.title: Dawn of Punk : NYC 1970-1980
entry.summary: This list serves as somewhat of a soundtrack to the book: Please Kill Me: A Oral History of Punk. Rooted essenitially in NYC, the book provides a detailed account of the scene and the music. Soon to follow will be:...
entry.dc:subject: shows
entry.content:
This list serves as somewhat of a soundtrack to the book: Please Kill Me: A Oral History of Punk. Rooted essenitially in NYC, the book provides a detailed account of the scene and the music. Soon to follow will be: Hip Hop NYC 1970-1980.

Before we get all that mail... yes, I know as well as you that the MC5, Iggy Pop (both Detroit) and the Dead Boys (Cincinnati) are not from NYC. But their impact on the scene and the musicians in the rest of the list is fairly significant.

The Velvet Underground
MC5
The Stooges
The Ramones
The New York Dolls
Suicide
The Dictators
Patti Smith
Blondie
The Dead Boys
Television
Richard Hell and the Voidoids
The Talking Heads
The Heartbreakers
Johnny Thunders
Iggy Pop
Lou Reed
